did.abstract: Lieutenant Governor of Michigan, 1907-1911, and Republican member of the U.S. House of Representatives. Correspondence, newspaper clippings, speeches and scrapbook concerning his political career and private law practice. Correspondents include: Calvin Coolidge, Louis C. Cramton, Oramel B. Fuller, Chase S. Osborn, Arthur J. Tuttle, Arthur H. Vandenberg, and James E. Watson.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was the gift of C. Bruce Kelley (donor no. 4951) and came to the library in 1970.

accruals.p: Periodic additions to the records are not expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Patrick Henry Kelley papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Patrick Henry Kelley was US Congressman from Michigan. He was born near Dowagiac, Silver Creek Township, Cass County, Michigan on October 7, 1867. He moved to Berrien County with his parents, who settled in Watervliet in 1875. He graduated from the Valparaiso (Ind.) Normal School in 1887, then taught school at Fair Plain for several years before attending Michigan Normal College in Ypsilanti. He graduated from the law department of the University of Michigan in 1900. After being admitted to the bar, he commenced the practice of law in Lansing, Mich.

Kelley was also politically active. He was a member of the State Board of Education, 1901-1905; State Superintendent of Public Instruction, 1905-1907; and Lieutenant Governor of Michigan ,1907-1911. He was elected as a Republican to the US House of Representatives in 1912, serving five terms, 1913-1923. He did not seek re-nomination, deciding instead to become a candidate for a seat in the Senate. His bid was unsuccessful and thus he returned the practice of law in Lansing, Mich. He died September 11, 1925.

scopecontent.p: The collection is arranged into three series: Correspondence; U.S. House of Representatives, 1913-1923; and Photographs.

note.p: (include letters from Louis C. Cramton throughout 1923)
(include letters from Chase S. Osborn, June 18 and June 26; also letters from Oramel B. Fuller, June 24 and June 25)
(include letter from Arthur Vandenberg, August 15 and August 27; also letter from James E. Watson, August 10)
(include letters from Oramel B. Fuller, January 5 and January 7; also letter from Arthur J. Tuttle)

did.unittitle: Scrapbook of speeches delivered in the U.S. House of Representatives, 1913-1917
Portraits of PHK and of associates of PHK
